text: It depends on the part of the game you're playing, too. Valve's games have a fantastic mixture of atmospheric tracks and awesome, intense tracks. Listening to the Portal 2 soundtrack, I really can't tell that Robot Ghost Story and The Part Where He Kills You are even from the same game.

text:
It's Breakout on hallucinogens and caffeine with great music!
one of my favorite games and absolutely my favorite soundtrack! $10 at CD Baby for all the MP3's, $15 for the CD. Just so you guys know.   (on the original site it's $35 for the CD, $3 each track apart)

text: Very talented composer, and such a great soundtrack overall.
author: Simon Quattrone

text: atmospheric music isn't always bad though. Some games were built around atmosphere which doesn't have to be a bad thing. I'd agree graphics don't matter as much, but speaking only about music, some games are just better with atmospheric tracks, so it's not "unfortunate".
author: videobun

text: Shatter is a game where the music itself is the highlight of the game. I think this shows how important vgm is . Graphics don´t matter (except for simulations), but music certainly do and therefore I hope many video game companies would make as awesome soundtracks as in the 90´s. But unfortunately all they care about are atmospheric tracks and most importantly stunning graphics...
